an10.79:1.1: “Mendicants, there are ten grounds for resentment.
an10.79:1.3: Thinking: ‘They did wrong to me,’ you harbor resentment.
an10.79:1.4: Thinking: ‘They are doing wrong to me’ …
an10.79:1.6: ‘They did wrong by someone I love’ …
an10.79:1.7: ‘They are doing wrong by someone I love’ …
an10.79:1.8: ‘They will do wrong by someone I love’ …
an10.79:1.11: Thinking: ‘They will help someone I dislike,’ you harbor resentment.
an10.79:1.12: You get angry for no reason.
an10.79:1.13: These are the ten grounds for resentment.”
